Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Azure Search Service does not reload query keys" (#7786) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
1. Query (read-only) key was rotated at T-48H
1. Old query key was invalided at T-0H
1. Service started failing all requests.

The sad part is monitoring was saying that secrets were being reloaded. This indicates a bug in secret reloading for the Azure Search client. Maybe it's a singleton when it should really be reloaded periodically?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/71222960-37c7ed00-2287-11ea-9784-f43d687ac5ef.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[PackageType]Investigate performance impacts" (#7703) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We have to use `$filter` instead of search text filtering since we don't want unscoped terms to search in the package type field.

So, we test these two things:

1. [x] regression test, performance of existing query patterns
    - Ran standard load test against 6 P3 instances, Azure Search scale 12/3.
      - Note that none of these queries filter by package type
    - Without package types fields: [995](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_apps/hub/ms.vss-cloudloadtest-web.hub-loadtest-test?_a=summary&runId=9bc3f252-c2dc-4e33-a624-1330012f4dd2&name=nuget-search-service-forever.jmx&definitionId=e3452fa0-8c13-4d84-b72f-3af9d9e9f2ff&definitionType=jMeter) - 253ms, 986.5RPS
    - With package types fields: [996](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_apps/hub/ms.vss-cloudloadtest-web.hub-loadtest-test?_a=summary&runId=ebd20e71-1daf-43de-bca1-532d52037fd2&name=nuget-search-service-forever.jmx&definitionId=41cab907-897b-47b9-a203-4d333eb204e0&definitionType=jMeter) - 261.2ms, 955.6RPS
1. [x] test performance of the new query pattern
    - `/query?q=dotnettool` - 308ms
    - `/query?q=dotnettool&packageType=dotnettool` - 312ms

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add NPS survey to NuGet.org" (#7385) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
# Resources

* [Usabilla homepage](https://usabilla.com/)
* Examples: [Visual Studio website](https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/#) and [.NET Blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/). Text reads `What do you think of this page?` Selecting a value (1-5) opens a text area that reads `How was your experience?`. This is placed on all pages.
* [What is Net Promoter Score (NPS)?](https://usabilla.com/net-promoter-score-nps/)
* [JavaScript API](https://support.usabilla.com/hc/en-us/articles/208019369-How-to-use-our-JavaScript-API-Command-List-), can be used to export data

# Steps

- [x] Karan+Joel: Make sure we're good from a GDPR standpoint on Usabilla
- [x] Joel: How can we/must we obfuscate URLs sent in feedback?
- [x] Karan+Joel: Add an SVG version of the feedback button
- [x] Joel: Deploy to DEV with a test button ID so we can play
- [x] Karan: submit customization of the form so we have NuGet logo or whatever
  - [x] Submitted
  - [x] Verified
- [x] Karan: provide Joel with 3 button IDs for DEV, INT, and PROD.
- [x] Joel: Check in button IDs to config
- [x] Joel: Merge change to dev branch
- [x] Joel: Deploy all the way to PROD
- [x] Joel: Turn feature flag on

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[PackageType]Rebuild index on all environments" (#7752) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Feedback button should not appear if script is blocked" (#7784) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Browser extensions like uBlock Origin block some "tracking" scripts. This can effect the loading of the Usabilla JavaScript snippet. In such a case, the feedback button should not appear.

Today, if the Usabilla script is blocked the button still appears (because we have a custom button) but does nothing when we click it. This is confusing.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "CSProj doesn't find central version from Directory.Packages.props" (#8951) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I created Directory.Packages.props file at solution level, but project doesn't refer Directory.Packages.props for version. Followed steps from https://github.com/NuGet/Home/wiki/Centrally-managing-NuGet-package-versions. 

[central-level-pkg.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/3971647/central-level-pkg.zip)
@lovakumar

Please suggest if I am missing something.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure]Confusing supported .NET Framework version v0.0 show in the error NU1202 message when installing a package into a project with incompatible framework" (#8965) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.5.0.6353
VS Version: Master\29619.96
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Create a C# Blank App (Universal Windows) template via VS.
2. Open PM UI of the project by right-clicking the project->Manage NuGet Packages… in Solution Explorer.
3. Search the package “Blend.Interactivity.Wpf” in Browse tab and install it.
4. Look at the error message in Error List window.
## Expected
Package supported .NET Framework version v0.0 will not show in the error NU1202 message.
## Actual
Confusing supported .NET Framework version v0.0 show in the error NU1202 message as below screenshot. NuGet should prevent user to input wrong .NET Framework version if that is coming from user.
![NU1202ErrorMessage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/71240297-b8e4ba00-2343-11ea-9a63-6d55dff07711.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Temporary fix on patching SDK for System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.dll " (#8508) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When implementing verification and signing, we bring in System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.dll and several dlls for netstandard2.1, which is in extension but not in netcoreapp3.x/5.0. 
So we encounter an exception of System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.dll not found in patching tests as those dlls are not brought in in SDK.
For now, we need to temporary copy those dlls and update the deps.json files in patching.
For permeate fix, we need to wait for SDK team bring in those dlls.

Should create an SDK issue and point to it. 
https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/3629
https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8570

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Test Failure][Accessibility] Cannot do any mouse control when the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is checked by Tab" (#8964) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.5.0.6353
VS Version: Master\29619.96
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps
1. Launch VS and click “Create a New Project” button.
2. Create an ASP.NET Web Application (.NET Framework) project (Single Page Application).
3. Open PM UI of this project and go to ‘Updates’ tab.
4. Navigate by Tab to the package list.
5. There is a dash-line showing on the outer edge of the first package.
6. Hit Tab again, attempt to focus on the check-box of this package.
7. Hit Space on the keyboard to check the check-box.
8. Try to click another package by mouse.
## Expected
Mouse control should also be successful when the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is checked by Tab.
## Actual
Cannot do any mouse control when the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is checked by Tab.
## Note
It repro on 16.2 GA (D16.2\29116.123) with implicit NuGet 5.2.0.6090.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Test Failure][Accessibility] Hard to see the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is focused with a dash-line box when navigating through Tab in Blue/Blue (Extra Contrast)/Light themes" (#8963) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet version: NuGet Client Dev\5.5.0.6353
VS Version: Master\29619.96
OS: Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5
## Detailed repro steps 
1. Launch VS and click “Create a New Project” button.
2. Create an ASP.NET Web Application (.NET Framework) project (Single Page Application).
3. Open PM UI of this project and go to ‘Updates’ tab.
4. Navigate by Tab to the package list.
5. There is a dash-line showing on the outer edge of the first package.
6. Hit Tab again, attempt to focus on the check-box of this package.
## Expected
Easy to see the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is focused with a dash-line box. 
## Actual
Hard to see the check-box of package in ‘Updates’ Tab is focused with a dash-line box as below screenshot. Note: actually it is focused since you can see the “√” when hitting Space on keyboard.
![CannotSeeDashLineBox](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/71239864-91412200-2342-11ea-9f5e-a25e991c32ea.png)
## Note
1. It repro on 16.2 GA (D16.2\29116.123) with implicit NuGet 5.2.0.6090.
2. It doesn’t repro in Dark theme.
3. Resolution suggested: make the bash-box a little bigger than the check-box.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Show NuGet commands in context menu" (#8041) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Show `Manage NuGet Packages` as an option on
- [x] `Dependencies` node's context menu for SDK style projects https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5049 (Released in 16.4 Preview 2)
- [x] `Packages` node's context menu for SDK style projects https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5049 (Released in 16.4 Preview 2)
- [x] `References` node's context menu for csproj.dll based projects


(Note: 'NuGet' node was renamed to 'Packages' in 16.3)

From Developer community suggestion: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/idea/622379/add-manage-nuget-packages-to-context-menu.html
GitHub Issue: https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/5049

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Linux FuncTests should run against dotnet 3.1 not 2.2" (#8949) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Recent temporary workaround resulted in dotnet 3.1 not running against our Functional Tests on Linux. dotnet 2.2 is currently being used.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`Manage Nuget Packages for Solution` not showing packages installed per project (for .net core 3.1 packages)" (#8959) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):

NugetPackageManager 5.4.0
Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 16.4.2
Nuget.exe (on server):  5.3.1

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):
1.1.8 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.104 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.200 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.201 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.202 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.302 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.402 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.403 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.500 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.502 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.503 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.504 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.505 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.507 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.602 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.604 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.700 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.701 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.801 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.1.802 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.2.101 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.2.102 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.2.203 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
2.2.300 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
3.0.100 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]
3.1.100 [C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk]

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
win7

**NuGet.Server version:  3.1.2**

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
Worked before (search 2.2.* packages) : 4.4.1

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1.
create bat file:
nuget.exe add %1 -source \\nuget-server\nuget_core3\
2.
Add 3.1.0 packages like: Microsoft.Extensions.Logging 3.1.0 on server feed

3. Try to search it by Nuget Package Manager.
4. Fail.
...

## Other suggested things
I can not search any 3.1.* nuget packages, but Microsoft.Extensions.FileProviders.Embedded search (3.1.0 version).
And i can search all core packages 2.2.* version.

### Verbose Logs

Other important thing:

I can not push some packages. Not all, just few.

Example:
C:\PushToIntegration_Core3>nuget.exe push "C:\PushToIntegration_Core3\Core3\microsoft.aspnetcore.jsonpatch.3.1.0.nupkg" -source C:\nugetRep\nuget_integration_core3  -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.3.1.6268
Pushing microsoft.aspnetcore.jsonpatch.3.1.0.nupkg to 'C:\nugetRep\nuget_core3'...
Acquiring lock for the installation of Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch 3.1.0
Acquired lock for the installation of Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch 3.1.0
Installing Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch 3.1.0.

And it stops here. But package add on folder feed. 
P.S. after add --verbouse flag - package add (after large timeout, like a minute):

PackageSignatureVerificationLog: PackageIdentity: Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch.3.1.0 Source:  PackageSignatureValidity: True
Completed installation of Microsoft.AspNetCore.JsonPatch 3.1.0
Successfully added package 'C:\PushToIntegration_Core3\Core3\microsoft.aspnetcore.jsonpatch.3.1.0.nupkg' to feed 'C:\nugetRep\nuget_core3'.
Your package was pushed.
